column4: does anyone know how to set the screen resolution to 1280x1024 in ubuntu? i have a 17" lcd and it's blocked out
does anyone know how to set the screen resolution to 1280x1024 in ubuntu? i have a 17" lcd and it's blocked out
im using the live cd, and i chose the right resolution
The command you gave didn't work.
How do I change my screen resolution?
does it not give you the option you want?
does it not show up in the bottom line?  are you using xchat?
you should have a red button with my name on it at the bottom
type in sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf  scroll down to the deafult depth you want and type in "1280x1024" in it resolution list.  then restart X
I don't know why there is no 32 in xorg.conf
sorry I didn't know you were on a livecd :P
